course_title: Informatics Solutions for Public Health Decision Making
class_notes: EMPH Students Only; Outside permission to enroll in course must be approved by EMPH leadership. EMPH Opening Weekend is 1/7-1/9 and Closing Weekend is 4/8-4/10.
course_description: The purpose of this course is to provide students an exploration of classic data warehouse and data fusion methods along with developing an understanding of the variability of data structures that support knowledge derivation and decision support in public health. The course will extend into new areas of knowledge and decision support methods and systems by exploring "big data" concepts and approaches to systems that support these new architectures. Another critical area for decision-making is the visualization of data. Data visualization, data reporting, and active data manipulation approaches and tools will be explored. This will include advanced tools like GIS, OLTP, and visualization systems.
sections: Class Nbr: 3427, Section #: 901, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: FSa 8:30-11:30a, Instructor: P. Edwards, Status: Open
